Example 9. A variety of data sets can be described as a time-series collected along a track. Examples are magnetic anomalies and seismic traces. This illustration shows deflections of the vertical along several sub-parallel Geosat tracks over some south-Pacific fracture zones. The program pswiggle plots the anomalies, while psxy and pstext draw other features and anotates the plot.
